com.vmware.vcenter.compute

Interface Policies

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, PoliciesTypes, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PoliciesStub

    public interface Policies
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, PoliciesTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Policies interface provides methods to manage compute policies. A compute policy defines the intended behavior for a collection of vSphere objects identified by a tag. A compute policy is an instance of a capability. It is created by providing a value for the creation type specified by the capability. See CapabilitiesTypes.Info.getCreateSpecType().

    • Method Detail

      • create

        Policies.CreateInvocation create(com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Structure spec)
        Creates a new compute policy.

        Invocation Result:
        The identifier of the newly created policy. Use this identifier to get or destroy the policy. The return value will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.compute.Policy.

        Parameters:
        spec - Specification for the new policy to be created. The new policy will be an instance of the capability that has the creation type (see CapabilitiesTypes.Info.getCreateSpecType()) equal to the type of the specified value (see spec). The parameter must contain all the properties defined in CreateSpec.
        Returns:
        instance of Policies.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExists - if a policy with the same name is already present on this vCenter server.
        InvalidArgument - if a parameter passed in the spec is invalid.
        UnableToAllocateResource - if more than 100 policies are created.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • Method execution requires ComputePolicy.Manage.

      • list

        Policies.ListInvocation list()
        Returns information about the compute policies available in this vCenter server.

        Invocation Result:
        The list of compute policies available on this vCenter server.

        Returns:
        instance of Policies.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • Method execution requires System.Read.

      • get

        Policies.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String policy)
        Returns information about a specific compute policy.

        Invocation Result:
        Detailed information about the specified compute policy. The returned value can be converted to the information type of the capability that this policy is based on. See CapabilitiesTypes.Info.getInfoType(). The return value will contain all the properties defined in Info.

        Parameters:
        policy - Identifier of the policy for which information should be retrieved. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.compute.Policy.
        Returns:
        instance of Policies.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        NotFound - if a policy with this identifier does not exist.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • Method execution requires System.Read.

      • delete

        Policies.DeleteInvocation delete(java.lang.String policy)
        Deletes a specific compute policy.
        Parameters:
        policy - Identifier of the policy to be deleted. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vcenter.compute.Policy.
        Returns:
        instance of Policies.DeleteInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described delete operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        NotFound - if a policy with this identifier does not exist.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
        Unauthorized - if you do not have all of the privileges described as follows:
        • Method execution requires ComputePolicy.Manage.
